div.div: In a short run of 20 mins it only worked 4 mins, the rest of the time it froze, don't use this app.
I love this app it is a good app for my kids! It make them run🏃🏃 all day!

div.strong: That should call this crasher not runt

div.div: I opened it, it crashes. I open it again, it crashes again ---repeat repeat repeat. My wife downloads it and it does the same thing on her I phone6 too. This app is a joke. One out of four times it will work. Pretty useless if you actually intend to run.
I spent time to write a full review my problem with program pausing then when I hit send it said the name I had chosen was taken and it threw out everything I wrote
This is so simple and easy to use. I just step out the door and hit start. Love the updates and easy to read display

div.strong: Pretty good running app. A few improvements though

div.div:
Good app, nice interface, and very useful.
Some improvements could be caloric count not being 0 all the time ( although I do not use it, it is odd hearing that your 5k ended up at 0 kcals ) and not having to buy a better version to keep all your logs. $3.99 a year or $0.99 a month. Really?

This is the first running app I have used. I like that it starts quickly and gives updates. However, it gives me different distance calculations than my car. It appears to be about .25 miles under distance. It also doesn't display the calorie count either. I'm not so concerned about the calorie count, so that is not a real issue with me. Also, as another person mentioned, the pace tracker seems to be way off. I was sprinting and it told me that I was doing a 14 min/mile pace.

div.strong: Decent but Pace Calculations are Wrong

div.div: I like this app a lot except the calculations for your run pace are way off. I was running at about a 9 minute mile pace based on total time and distance, but every quarter mile it would give an update with the pace fluctuating from 6 to 14 minute miles. Fix that bug and I would rate it 5 stars.

I used to love this app especially because the running feedback was fast so I didn't miss much of the podcasts I listen to when I run. But the new update, the voice is super slow! At first, I thought there was something wrong with the fun but it's the voice. At least make it normal speed, it's like 0.5X the normal speaking speed and it's super annoying.

I had not used the app before today's run. I was excited to give it a shot. Looked pretty cool and I liked the features. But... As soon as I navigated away to other apps like my camera, it stopped recording data. Our 5k looks like. 10 min 1k run :-( I'll keep it on my phone till I find another option or it can be run in the background.

I have had constant issues with this app. It works great of you leave it up and running but if it becomes a "background" program it stops recording distance/location which is total bull when you are trying to get a good run time in. Over this app, buying a garmin watch

div.strong: I've liked it for a while now

div.div: So with the new update, for those of us who had it before, we automatically got bumped up to premium. However, I can't get my music controls anymore and that was personally my favorite part of the app. Is there a way to fix this problem?
Love the integration with Game Center and the ease of use.
It's so much easier and cleaner than other apps I've tried. I really like this one! Absolutely fantastic, my favorite on the App Store.
It doesn't restart your run after it pauses. Also screws with the volume not coming back up. Probably going on my app garbage pile.

I've used this to track when I walk every night. It's good to see the distance for each route I take and all the variations, and it's a nice motivator to be made aware as I'm burning calories and reaching distances.
Encouraging updates. Easy to share a run. Friendly and motivating reminders. Impeccable GPS and distance accuracy. My favorite running buddy!
It stops counting when you turn the growling phone off so I didn't get anything on my run
I love that I can map out my run and keep track of my progress. It also helps to have the little run reminders when I'm not quite feeling like exercising! :)

div.strong: Great app. Keeps me on track on my runs.

div.div: Love this app

I'm a beginner "app" runner, so I definitely didn't want anything complicated. Runr has ultra simplistic UX so you can concentrate on the run and not some unwieldy interface on your phone. Also does a great job as additional motivation!
Simple and motivating
BesT.
Very useful I will be using it myself

This app does EXACTY what you want: tracks your runs. No fancy accounts. Just running. The scoring and competitions through Game Center are silly, but they add to the fun. I think this may replace Runkeeper for me.
This app keeps me fitKeeps me from being boredAmazing

It is very simple, which I like. I have used other apps, such as Runtastic and MapMyRun. They are nice, but sometimes a little too busy. Runr is very clean, with less of the complexity in the other apps.
The integration with Game Center is really clever and achievements make running even more fun! The interface is also really minimalistic and nice!Greetings from Sweden.

Runr is different from all other running apps I tried. I don't have to mess with settings. I like it. And the Game Center achievements / scores are a nice touch. Very well designed, thought out and executed.
Love the integration with Game Center and the ease of use.
Love the ease of this app. Feedback keeps me on track and motivated.

This is an elegant and simple app for runners that blows other running apps out of the water. It is secure--it doesn't share your running location or info without your permission. More impressive is the ease with which you can begin to track your run. Just tap Start a Run. In a word, Awesome!

div.strong: My friends and I love it
div.span: by The Puerto Rican white boy

div.div: Possibly the best app for running made, ever! This app is really different from all the other running apps that are out there, and it's the good that sets it apart. The leaderboards and races make it fun and competitive for my friends and I, and the graphs show us meaningful data - not some mumbo jumbo that would require a certification to understand. I really like this app and hope that other people do too!

div.strong: Way different, in a good way

div.div: Runr is a lot different from all of the other running apps out there - it's clean, it's simple, I don't have to mess with a pile of settings. I like it. And the Game Center achievements / scores are a nice touch. Very well designed, thought out and executed.
